quotes.quote: While focusing on a niche skill might be the flavor in the market now with people willing to pay big bucks for your expertise, you also need to consider the "sustainability" of your skill some years down the line.
Even if you are not 1% comfortable in relocating, donâ€™t do it. It might not be worth the pain.
As a contractor, you are mostly called to "solve" crucial problems and building solutions which are niche and "first time been done" cases.
Job-hoppers tend to be associated with the stigma of instability and recklessness by their potential employers.
However, always try to exhaust all possible options in your current organization before switching to the new one. A known demon is always much better than an unknown devil.

title: The Key to Being a Successful Programmer.
